de.tum.bgu.lfk.processing.menu

Class PExpandableMenu

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.tum.bgu.lfk.processing.menu.PExpandableMenu
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class PExpandableMenu
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.MouseListener
    having a button with a icon at the top, left, bottom or right which expands on clicking. after expanding it give some possibilities to set value or so. An addElements(Object o) function has to be implemented.
    Since:
    23.02.2015
    Version:
    0.0.1
    Author:
    Mathias Jahnke, Technische Universität München, Chair of Cartography

      • setStyling

        public void setStyling(java.lang.Integer stroke,
              java.lang.Integer strokeHighlight,
              java.lang.Integer fill,
              java.lang.Integer fillHighlight)
        sets the stroke and fill color of the menu. the color(r,g,b)-function should be used.
        Parameters:
        stroke - the color of the border.
        strokeHighlight - the color of the border on focus.
        fill - the fill color of the opened menu and the handle.
        fillHighlight - the fill color of the opened Menu and the handle on focus.

        public boolean isInside(float x,

        checks if the x and y coordinates are falling inside the handle area
        Parameters:

        y - the y coordinate
        Returns:
        true if inside otherwise false
